UorJ71d3CDDNzX6moFG4JA.text: Review from visit July 2010.   Was with my parents so wanted it to be a fantastic dining experience, and it just wasn't.   The food was good - we did the early dinner prix fixe special (portions a bit awkward, tiny 1st plates with enormous 2nd plates.)  My problem was the service. We had a reservation, and the place was NOT crowded atall. Even so, service was below average. We waited a solid 10 minutes before getting waters or drink menus. After that, it wasn't clear who was our server. 4 different people came to bring us things throughout the night, no one made a clear introduction or greeting at the beginning.   So overall this left a bad taste in my mouth. Perhaps I was particularly sensitive as I wanted my parents to feel welcomed to my city. Service was bad enough that I wouldn't return despite the good food. I'd rather keep looking around for a place that meets exceptional standards across the board.

o7omcVw43H4u0DrZXrINyw.text: I love my fish. Give me anything wet, slippery and deed, and I will happily eat it (if it's fish, obviously. Not so keen on eels)  I had never ever fancied fish curry until I saw it on the menu in this gorgeous restaurant/bistro, and I can honestly say it was beyond fantastical. Yummyness which knows no bounds. Wow. I can't even praise it enough.  The Kerala red fish curry, which was packed with pollock and prawns too, was outstanding. It had just the right amount of spice, and packed full of fishy goodness. The rice was fragrant, which complimented the fish and spices beautifully. I think you get the picture, but WOW! I urge you to try it.  As well as gorgeous food, beautifully understated surroundings and a menu which caters for us fish-lovers, the prices are incredibly good value for money. My fish curry (did I mention it was AWESOME?) only cost 13.95, which is probably much less than the quantity of seafood in it is actually worth at cost price!   Perfection. If you love fish, you will absolutely love Fishers in the City.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

q9lWHpiJiCsQW11hYvyySw.text: Had reservations and were excited to eat here. Unfortunately, the kitchen was excruciatingly slow, and the waitstaff did not seemed concerned about the delays in the least. The food did not redeem the poor service: scallops were rubbery, spinach overcooked. I wouldn't recommend Fishers in the City.

BEisGrk2x2L8ls91TU1yig.text: If you like seafood, good seafood, then you HAVE to come to Fishers. It's absolutely amazing!! I never knew fish could taste so so good.  Their menu is really good (if maybe a bit small, but that suits me fine) and they always have some specials. I must say though - if you go here on this recommendation then you have to have the mussels too. They have a smaller starter portion and a large main, but to be honest the starter is more than enough! I was too full for my halibut after the mussels. If you're a mussels fan - or even if you're not - try these mussels. D.E.L.I.C.I.O.U.S!!!!!!  They always have a meat option too if you don't fancy fish.  The bad thing about Fishers is the toilets...or lack thereof! They need more than one!!

10qD1D6KaDeMM2JzHUqSlA.text: I'll have to agree with Blythe R on this restaurant.  While they certainly use great ingredients, I'm not convinced with the way they put them all together. I had the waiter recommended Orkney Scallops, and while I thought the use of the smoked salmon hollandaise was interesting, the creamy sauce was too overwhelming  for the scallops, in my opinion.  I'd be willing to give this restaurant another try, next time I'm in town, but for now, it was just ok.

fMLRDgNFVqGltg3oqi-NCQ.text: My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday, and it was a very special evening. The menu focuses on fresh, locally caught seafood, and masterful cooking and presentation. The wine list was extensivewe chose the Pouilly-Fume, which complemented our meals perfectly. The mussels were perfect, and the scallops some of the best I've ever tasted. The monkfish (seasonal) was good enough to make the eater chew with their eyes closed.   Attentive and efficient service, but not too attentive. Smart-casual, trendy crowd. Our only complain was that we were sat in the middle of the room and this lessened the romantic element a bitadmittedly, this is a peeve of mine. Overall, a great meal in a pleasant atmosphere!

hvE66kmcrcOfUMaVtbDLNw.text: I much prefer this one to the one on the Shore, its tucked away behind the main shops and although always busy is always a welcome rest. Obviously their main dish is fish, they do some non-fish dishes but not many (I saw veal on menu last time I was there).  The portions are pretty large. If going for the mussels ask for the starter portion, believe me its enough for most. The mussels in white wine sauce is one of their most popular dishes and is divine, it comes with crusty bread. Their second most popular dish is their fish cakes with sweet chilli sauce. Specials are available every day and I've seen them range from sea bass, monkfish to swordfish.   This isn't a cheap restaurant but a bowl of mussels and a glass of wine will set you back about ten pounds which isn't bad. The staff are friendly and helpful and even when the place is packed you don't feel hemmed in, I don't know how they've managed it but it feels quite spacious even when full.

wPnyucYyd2dLVZhaLdUCcw.text: Lots of choices for seafood.  The monkfish cheeks and pea soup was amazing.  However the shellfish platter wasn't as great as it should have been.  There was plenty on the plate (too much for one person I found) but the qualify of some of the items was just average.

zJY2EpYodhrNyouVB-bj9g.text: Had an arugula salad and the fish curry. Both were out of this world. I wanted to go back for seconds the next night! Everyone in our group enjoyed the meal.

eGxHjYkXgLn37bcHcJmxVQ.text: Great seafood dishes such as Loch Fyne oysters, fresh mussels in white wine sauce, mmm making my mouth water just thinking about it! i always think the secret of enjoying good food is having good service to go with it, something that I've always found here. The staff are always happy to go through ingredients on the menu, and advise on the right wine to go with your meal. Essential to book!!

j8ZyLQy461gFUnMnlt3iWw.text: 2 weeks later i still remember the amazing sole i had at fishers the city ! nice place, really great food, great wisky selection, friendly and perfect service. I won't miss to go back on my next trip in Edinburgh !

h_5dCOHjMCgPit2c4vHz6A.text: Shame the owners are so objectionable!

Fl7zKAe5VNCPu5SA1zTsLA.text: What a treasure! Nestled away from the boutique hotels, cavernous pubs, and pretentious lounges of George Street, Fishers in the City is an oasis of calm and understated confidence in its own quality, with professional, unhurriedly gracious staff cleverly balancing their approach between over-familarity and cold supersilience. A joy to be steered from entrance to table, with an aperitif at the well-stocked bar on the way, and helpfully guided through the excellent menu and competent wine list. Whoever trains the staff deserves compliments. All this is nothing without commensurate qualities in the food cooking and presentation and here again we have nothing but plaudits. A surprise lunch for two booked by my wife to mark my recent 60th was our latest visit. More usually evening patrons of Fishers, I soon had any hint of reservation on my part dispelled and the lunch was without doubt one of the high spots of my birthday celebrations.

3AN4sgttiqUPr6hNOdqzlA.text: Started with cold bread, but we are going to look past it. Went to an immediate high with the fish cake.  And that kept getting higher with the North Sea Hake  main and a full rainbow trout dish.  Recommended.

bBUJYcjkd_dRx6mqKj8mAg.text: AMAZING.  One if the best meals of my life...perfectly cooked seafood and one of the best service teams I've seen.  Richard and James topped off the great food.  We managed to sneak in but a resy would make life easier.  We snuck into the lounge (same menu but closer to the bevys!!).  Work it in and you won't regret it.

O5Ap5r-7ScDTaN-PBArncw.text: Great seafood platter with smoked salmon, gravlax etc. Awesome hot seafood as well!  The mussels were a little mealy but overall delicious and well priced (6.5 GBP for a shareable small portion).   Great place for lunch and ABSOLUTELY excellent for  smoked salmon!

27j_BkXxfqbQ_XYnAYR3qA.text: I will give it a 4 stars but one irritating waiter made me so upset. She has been such a moody waiter with not pleasant face. I felt uncomfortable but stil tried to be nice coz i just want to enjoy my dinner with my husband. She asked if i want anything for dessert, i said yes and i wanted the menu to see. She gave me the main course menu. I asked, i want dessert menu. She tried to lecture me and said, oh because u spoke bla bla bla and i heard menu, and not dessert menu. Wth... she's tried to cover up her mistake by blaming me. I stil calm me self up. I had a great dessert, i love it. We finished up. She asked, r u finished? "Yes" she cleaned up. She just kinda threw the bill after that on our table. I never asked for the bill. Two weeks trip on UK, i never had this experience. Someone just threw me a bill. Passed by our table and threw it there without saying anything.  This woman is really something. The others like the manager or waiters are so nice. This one really..

yvf4OycyytCHJSj9L3Sq3A.text: Very nice seafood restaurant - highly recommend the Curry coley and Pawn with jasmine rice.

VTi0rvxQOFqhnSXnXghM-g.text: I absolutely have to give Fishers a resounding five stars, as after trying almost everything they have on the menu over the last few years, I am now happy to say I've gathered enough food sampling evidence to conclude that this place is always awesome.  Consistently amazing food is the the aim of every restaurant I would imagine, and Fishers has certainly succeeded in attaining this. Not once have I ever come in here and found something to be tasteless, bland, or anything less than delicious. Neither has my food ever arrived late, plus the staff are always charming and accommodating.   The menu changes quite regularly at Fishers, but my personal recommendations from the regular menu fixtures would be the mussels, with whatever yummy sauce of the day is on offer, the fish cakes and the eternally fantastic scallops. And if you're not an avid seafood enthusiast, no stress required, there are always meat and veggie options to be had from the menu. Very reasonably priced for the generous portions and quality of food, so if you are arranging any kind of dinner that just has to be good, or else there'll be dubious consequences (first dinner with potential inlaws, clients you need to make a deal with, someone you want to manipulate into loving you through feeding them, you get the picture), then this is your place, I'm telling you.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Photo from fishersbistros.co.uk

L_S5W16I0T7RTSxQHxMOSg.text: My friend brought me here for lunch on my birthday, and as the world's biggest seafood junkie I was more than a little bit excited. As soon as you walk in, you see why everyone raves about how beautiful it is; I love the huge L-shaped aquarium that lines almost two entire walls of the raised area where we sat.  One thing I did think was cheeky though, was that despite my friend having phoned ahead to reserve a table for their Table D'Hote lunch menu, the waiter only gave us the A La Carte one. Which would have been fine, except that two courses from the set menu cost less than one single main course from the A La Carte. When we asked another waitress she brought us the set menu straightaway, but it annoyed me the way they were just trying to sneak as much money out of us as possible.  Rant over, the food was incredible. I honestly can't remember what my friend had, as I was so engrossed in my own food, it was that good! My starter of mackerel with a pine nut and green bean salad was really well-presented, and the drizzle of mint pesto around the edge added that extra little touch. But it was my main course that really trumped it: a huge fillet of seared coley sitting on a bed of greens and swimming in a shrimp and mussel bisque, and I'm actually getting hungry just writing about it. If they did takeaway I'm fairly sure I'd have my phone in my hand right now...  The fact that they do at least half a dozen different wines by the glass was also a definite plus point, and they were really reasonably priced considering the quality.  I think it's safe to say I will definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. image courtesy of www.fishersbistros.co.uk

tR4R85oZMi1hXIl4btjOXA.text: I adore Thistle Street, as it has some great places for dinner and/or drinks. Fishers didn't quite cut it, for me. It's a bit of a tourist trap, has an odd layout that really doesn't make best use of the space available, and the dishes didn't quite balance, for me.  Overall, we said: "Fishers in the City serves pretty good dishes, with good local ingredients, but somehow doesn't quite hit the mark, for me. I enjoyed the soup, muchly, and the lemon sole was lovely, but a little clearer thought needs applied to the construction of the dishes, to ensure that the best is made from the star ingredients. The business is making its money from tourist trade, and more power to its elbow for that, so my quibbles are less relevant to how they shape their service than those of their international clientele. I think there's room for improvement, but that improvement needs to ensure that it capitalises upon their current broad appeal."

f4i9gih4HoSqPs6mEeZZFw.text: Cod fish and chips were good, was hoping it would be best ever fish and hips experience, but just ok.  Fish chowder was pretty good - really rich.  Attentive service,

HqZPgk657WCPh6rciwb-0g.text: Fishers is an established seafood haven in Edinburgh. I really enjoy sitting at an old wooden table on the top level of the split-nautical fishy themed restaurant looking out over quiet Thistle Street.  When I left an old job they bought me, (amongst other things such as bad joke toilet paper and lots of packets of space raiders) a voucher to eat here - I was chuffed, not only because I never pass off a free meal and also having eaten here before, it certainly fills my fishy soft spot (sounds a bit rank-dirty eh?!)  Fresh, well cooked fish isn't the only thing you can get on the venue but it would be completely pointless to chose this if you weren't into things from the wet.  Friendly, professional staff (who to be honest always look like they're having a bad day, but try to hide it well) and fast table service.. Another bottle of wine? Bam, it's the there.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. photo from official website
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. photo from official website
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. photo from official website

A8A9WpZlWddLre8Kpb5h2w.text: Excellent food.  Warm service. Snails and mussels very special.  Good service.  Everything was delicious.  Good value.  Portions were a nice size.

kx7E1G5__Ap73wiGjMrHFg.text: Last minute visit when I was craving mussles. Staff were willing to fit us in last minute. They were so helpful and friendly during the evening. Even when we had special requests for our meals. Food was delightful and definitely fulfilled my craving. Fishers is a place I'm definitely coming back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Aope36n9L60LD7JCVz0ZfQ.text: Great seafood. Fine service. We had fish soup, which was good. Raw oysters were delicious. Mussels with garlic - we enjoyed a lot! I also had curry prawn and fish... Well, I didn't like it, but I think I just understood curry&seafood is not a very good idea for me. And in the end the sticky toffee was wonderful.  Pricing is fair - it was 50 pounds overall. Try have 16 pounds for a full course and that's how we got the soup, curry and toffee, but the oysters are individually not part of this. Overall - highly recommended!

qvKBxHMFEG-pLDY61_ZrXQ.text: Great place. Fantastic food, professional service and great drinks. The food was reasonably priced and appears a great effort was made in presentation. Every dished on the table looked delicious.  I will certainly be back when I am in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cod, parsnip &amp; smoked bacon smash, curly kale, Bordelaise sauce, Fishers in the City Edinburgh
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. 8oz Rib eye steak, chips, sautéed spinach &amp; wild mushrooms, Fishers in the City Edinburgh
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bombay Massala Curry with Coley &amp; King Prawns, Fishers in the City Edinburgh

1J8lhfrlYa-gjAX6mKhf8A.text: As I write this it occurred to me I do tend to always be giving restaurants high marks, then I realised it just i have great taste when it comes to booking places ;)  So anyway I was going to give this place 4 stars but then started thinking...... well....what am I taking a star off for........the wine was great......the service was great.........the food was awesome....so really yeah its got to be 5 stars.  As so what i had well this will come to no shock to many but I started off with a beautiful plate of oysters! Just stunning, fresh as can be and taste like the sea! (hold on the rhymes career in advertising here I come).  For main I had the bengali fish curry, now i wont for a second try and say whether or not it was authetntic but damn was it tasty. It was that kind of spicy there you mouth is kind of burnign but you dont care cause all of the falvours are just tremendous. If i had to criticise I would say would be nice to have some flatbread with it.  Desert was rhubarb trifle, really nice young rhubarb that had a beautiful biiter/sweet flavour.  JD = HAPPY man!!

vJb_lkf_-Y6GsT5ZMmlvzw.text: I love, love, love this place. From the time you first walk in and are tantalized by the wonderful smell to the impecible service and absolutely delicious food. This place is the best.   I HIGHLY recommend the Fish and Chips. It was the best I've ever had in my life!

MUUq5oGT4X0kHFbuNAGpkg.text: I have been to Fishers in Leith and Fishers in the City. Both restaurants are definitely one of the Top 5 Sea Food restaurants. The food is fresh and very delicious. As a starter I had the crab cake which was crunchy and tasted very good. As a main dish we ordered a sea food platter for two with lobster, oysters, clams, crabs and other kind of sea food. The portions were impressive and the prize was reasonable. My visit at Fishers was even better than expected. I can really recommend Fishers in the City and in Leith too.

5u8YgDLd34dBQO8-YF6x5g.text: Weekend trip to Edinburgh and chanced it on a Friday with no reservation - big props to the maitre d who hooked us up straight away, having read the positive reviews was expecting the place to deliver and it certainly did! Rating should be 4.5 stars, only downer was the halibut ceviche which wasn't as good as i thought it would be...  Oysters, scallops and langoustines were divine and the prosecco set it off lovely... bearing in mind e had just been doing our own DIY scotch tour in the bar down the road we eased off the booze and were pleasantly surprised by the very reasonable bill  highly recommended

ofM7ixE0Z-AZNW6ATLttPA.text: My boyfriend and I found the restaurant by accident on New Year's Eve in the early evening. Though we didn't have a reservation, they were able to squeeze us in at 6pm.   It was a fantastic experience!   We had the fishcakes appetizer, which was a little different than we were expecting (we though it would be more of a crabcake consistency), but it was very good. The Cod was sublime and the Lemon Sole was delicous as well.   Do your tastebuds a favor and go to Fishers!

7WROUOwD4wpyCoCyUT1wtQ.text: Fishers in the City is here to bring you food from the sea.  The atmosphere is fantastic with a nice classy feel.    Definitely try the sea food soup.  it was fantastic.  I was expecting life changing sea food from some of the things I had heard.  I got some great food, but it didn't change my life.

OeZI19LH2azjfRh3vHw_Hw.text: I wanted to taste how the Scots do seafood so I came here.  I was not disappointed, they do seafood very well!  I ordered the grilled squid for app and hot seafood platter for one as main.  Seasoning was on point and you can taste the freshness.  If you're in Edinburgh and feel like eating seafood, this is the place!  And leave room for dessert, the pudding is excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Seafood platter for one but can be shared cuz there&#39;s plenty!
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Grilled squid is tasty!

3M8H70fjWZNtnrb7IJwByQ.text: We read the reviews before making reservations at Fisher and were excited to have a nice dinner celebrating my birthday. We were 15 minutes early, 5:30 pm and the restaurant was quite empty.  The host seated us at a tiny table right next to the work station where all the glasses, water pitchers and utensils were. The other side is the kitchen counter.  I politely asked if we can seat at the empty table away from the work station (there were at least 4 tables available).  The hostess was not happy but agreed to seat us in one of the table.    We ordered two starters and two main dishes and I was not impressed.  The lobster salad was good but my fish was over cook and lack of taste. My husband order beef starter and cod fish and he said the fish had no taste but the beef was excellent.  While we were dining, tables started to fill up.  Our waitress seemed to be disappeared but there was a male server going around to greet the customers and asked if they were doing fine but not once, came to ask if we needed anything or how our meal was.    We felt ignored and I finally asked this male waiter to get our waitress.  He said, I'm your server!  The waitress has gone home.   Can I help you? Oh I said, can we get our bill?  No asking if we want desert or how the dinner was.  I won't recommend this restaurant and I won't be back for sure; the service is bad and the food is just average.  We are from California and have traveled to many countries but never felt being treated differently because we are Asian!  This is the first...and by the way my husband is American born speaking perfect English.

tPYxHReO8jnjRLAzVSuG5Q.text: Food was prepared with Great Skill. With Large Group and all the meals were great. Service was spotty and standard.

B3Q2y5ChtosxUR6B8CSB5g.text: We had a fabulous dinner... This is a place to seek out... They made room for us; however I would recommend reservations.   We loved Amy, Jemma (her evil twin :)) and Graeme, they were great with the patrons!    My husband who is not a seafood lover- enjoyed his ribeye and the three of us loved several of the seafood options... Can't go wrong!

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hot Shellfish Platter for 2!
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The scallops!

5HxrVXA5IR0UqticT6kjag.text: Not even kidding. Best dining experience we had in Edinburg.  Coming from a Wine Country/San Francisco Bay Area native, this  opinion is True.

lsgrvdpzAT5lZAK9Apq2Jw.text: Loved this place so much ate here twice.  Both were excellent.  The oysters are a must - fresh and tasty.  Had fish and chips as well as mussels among other things.  All were fantastic. On the second visit, the place was full, but the host did a great job and found us a spot.  Many other places would have just sent us away. Service was good.

DF4ARSbIYj09MW6yavgdig.text: Great food, lovely restaurant and well worth a visit. The scallops and pork belly was amazing and the home made ice blackberry cream was just incredible. The waiting staff were not very friendly or attentive though and let the kitchen down a little bit.

FeZgxn5qwY1OwZ-Iz9MZSw.text: Get the warm seafood platter!!!!  I was AHHH-MAZED on how sweet the seafood is in Edinburgh!  The seafood wasn't overcooked AT ALL.  There was butter and fresh herbs in the seafood platter but it wasn't greasy.  I also ordered a side salad.  It was small but fresh and good.  The sticky toffee is really good!  It's not overly sweet.  It's enough for two people.  I would definitely come back here!

I4A9JN4wCbW1YwETe2nuBQ.text: Went with a group of friends for dinner and drinks. I wasn't particularly feeling seafood that night so had steak for my main, which was hugely underwhelming. There was a lot of sinew and overall just not cooked well.  On the other hand, the cold mix plate to start was lovely and the wine list is impressive. I've heard Fishers in Leith is the one you want to go to, this it like the bumbling younger sibling that tries but just can't quite get it.

I5d4jQB34K5Y2q0zaL2Z0A.text: The restaurant has an cozy classic fee to it. The servers are attentive and friendly without hovering. I ordered from the prefixed lunch menu and my husband ordered a couple regular menu items. Everything was cooked and played well. The only complaint I had is that the lamb I had and the scallops my husband had were under seasoned. But this may simply be our American tastes because we ran into this problem almost everywhere in Edinburgh. But the atmosphere was upscale without being stuffy, and the service was wonderful. Definitely a good recommendation and worth another visit.

q7Tv93xTpFjAtOMOOZAPgA.text: Best Meal Of My Life!!! Seriously, I'm not even exaggerating. I had this massive seafood platter for $40....I was literally in heaven!! The plate came towering with seafood, everything a seafood lover could ever dream of. I literally licked the plate dry.  On top of a great meal, the restaurant itself is super adorable; Very cozy and personably. I would recommend making a reservation as it was packed the entire night and we kinda got "the eye" for not having a reso our selfs.   Anyways, I can't say enough good things abou this place, if you're in Edinburgh...GO HERE!

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Seafood platter!

aiO5yfzR7j3oWwMB6xTUVg.text: I love Fisher's in the City! They never disappoint. I've been here multiple times. The seafood is always fresh and tasty no matter what you order, whether it's oysters, scallops, mussels, fish and chips or monkfish. If you do visit this place PLEASE try the sticky toffee pudding!!! It is the best sticky toffee pudding I've had anywhere - mind-blowing.

PK-FDeHsdmCDgKiPLRDVJA.text: Excellent seafood and comfortable surroundings. A great place to take family, friends or colleagues if you want to impress and something a little more different in the city centre.   We shared the fish cakes to start - which were divine - my girlfriend had the half lobster (and chunky homemade chips), while I had the prawn Thai curry, with a delicious desert to share, washed down with coffee for only 22.50 each. Absolute bargain and left feeling warm and very satisfied.   The only reason why this isn't a 5 star is down to the service. Although everyone was pleasant, we felt the waitress was a bit pushy trying to increase the bill with extra starters and trying to sell us wine even though we weren't drinking. There was also a slightly pretentious vibe coming from the waiters despite its claim of casual dining.   But besides this minor point, this is an excellent restaurant and highly recommended.

JXmmKLLpMMyJ8dXxRXMPAw.text: Delicious seafood. This is a great place to sample Scottish shell fish on a trip. Enjoyed the scallops and seafood platter.

VJ7Xon8VL-KvqWUqGs8hmQ.text: The food is great. And the service too. This is my second time at the restaurant (my second time to Edinburgh too). It's so good that we have to re visit it again. Oysters are incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. This is my second time at the restaurant (as well as Edinburgh) it&#39;s so good that we have to re visit again.

BQdlt9V-TFUVk6kjEsVqZw.text: Solid 4 stars from me - was pretty great but I wasn't blown away, although I can't fault much.   We popped in for lunch - not the cheapest place in town but eating seafood in Scotland usually is an expensive business. I went for the lunch special - langoustines with scallops (23). I was pleased to see they served the scallops with roe on them - yes! Lots of people remove this which is just plain wrong and the scallops were decently sized - unfortunately one of my scallops was missing the roe :-(  Langoustines were perfectly cooked and really great. Eating shellfish can be a messy business but all the required 'equipment' was provided.  Service - good, left to chat and the occasional enquiry if we needed anything else but apart from that, all good. A glass of Sancerre went with the seafood and we ordered some chips on the side (salad came with the shellfish). The chips were ok, nothing special.  Staff can advise what is Gluten Free (GF) but no GF bread available.  So, decently, well prepared seafood in the centre of town.

DVQ3ZULM92gly93SltNrRg.text: I have had the pleasure of eating here twice now. It's a particular favourite for taking guests from out of town to. Fantastic locally Scottish fish, of which the Scottish Haddock is my particular favourite.  The service is good, the food is incredible and it's reasonably priced!  It has a nice independent feel to it. I would be very happy to recommend it, and I will be certainly going again!

tAJlqC7bi9sQg4s5bfkzDQ.text: A 4.5 star sea food! Every Oder we order is good ;) highly recommend! The price isn't too high ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

kEroAlAnQepCY8kr3deAtA.text: I've glanced at Fishers so many times, but the menu has never really leapt out at me, until tonight. We were roaming around seeking inspiration for an impromptu meal out, and after a few lacklustre 'hmm I guess that would do...' menus, we came across Fishers, and both of us lit up. I tucked into the spiced aubergine soup (tasty and spicy, with nice texture from almond slices) and penang curry which was lovely and had the perfect level of spice for me. The pineapple chutney was fantastic, the fruity flavour cut nicely through the rich coconut. The SR had the deluxe fish and chips (fish and battered prawns), some fantastic looking chips. I didn't get a look in, but then again, neither did he, we both jealously guarded our plates.   It's not a 5 star, I did think the service was at times a little too hovery, and I was floored when I saw the price of the curry (20)... I am not 100% convinced that although it was lovely, it was 20 lovely. But, saying that, I'd definitely recommend to others, and hope to return at some point as well.

t0-1j4fAL-ZA9EahkcBQ1A.text: Excellent meal. The fish stew was wonderfully done, and hand diver Orkney scallops simply delicious. Great service as well.

-UY5Aui97wIPDgI_0-9L-g.text: They had a great selection on their menu. We enjoyed the large seafood platter to share and it was delicious. They were even kind enough to move our reservation to a later time because our flight was late. We had great service and would recommend them to anyone.

-Pws1Yejwgyud5PknWB1oQ.text: Hand divided Orkney scallop is so tasty and amazing, must try this one. Fried calamari and Curry are also great, but not special. It is better if you have reservation. The staff who served us was not that friendly, and  overall was great except service.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

_ANPaX57ZEqlJ98S605YGw.text: Okay, I just need to say wow and start off with talking about dessert. I'm literally still thinking about the sticky toffee pudding we just had. It was hot and served with butterscotch and cream, and for an extra 50 pence you can have it with ice cream, which I would suggest is a must! It was seriously to die for. I was fortunate enough that I was still able to order from the pre-theatre menu even though it was after 6pm which meant I could order either a 2 course (15)or a 3 course meal for 18 Next up, (working backwards) was my main entree and I chose the Coley & King Prawn North Indian Curry, basmati rice. Again, this dish was fantastic and had the perfect amount of heat. My first course was also delicious. I chose the fishers fish stew and it is probably the best out of the three fish soups I've had since arriving in Scotland. If I have the opportunity to come back before my trip is over I would love to try the seafood platter. I noticed a few people around me order it and it looked amazing and was piled high with a variety of seafood including lobster and crab and was 95 for 2. I also noticed on their website that they have two other locations in Edinburgh with different menus. If the other two restaurants are anything like Fishers in the City you simply can't go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Y7jz0yxPepu8j6BTCBwuIg.text: Good food, but horrible service.  See, the thing is, you're charging prices that are more or less aligned with a higher mid-range to lower high-end restaurant. So at least train your servers to match that.   We wanted to have a nice dinner, wanting to order three starters to more or less construct a 3-course tasting menu. So my husband and I ordered (each of us) oysters, followed by two starters. The bad things started there.  See, if I wanted to order three items, and I made it clear that I wanted to do a small tasting menu so to speak, then I would expect the server to get out of the mindset that there should be a starter and a main course. Instead, our server was so fixated at figuring out what the starter should be, what the main course should be, and what my pre-starter should be. It was so confusing, when all she needed to figure out was which dish should be delivered first, then next, then last. I speak English too, and fluently at that, but I was confused as hell because she kept on insisting that I should tell her what my main course was. When you're in tasting menu mode, then what is the main course becomes less clear, no?  In short, the staff should be aware that not every diner orders a starter followed by a main course. Adapt accordingly.  There was also the case of the missing spoon. I ordered a dish with some broth, served in a deep plate, but you won't give me a spoon?  Finally, there was a mistake on the bill, so we had to have it taken out.  So yeah, it is a pity to have good stuff coming out of the kitchen, but the staff's abilities doesn't match it. Train your staff better! There's plenty of small mistakes which do add up and together they make the experience unpalatable. Right now they don't match the prices you charge.

_5eDGJlV37lVX1jFHsB0MA.text: the food was good. the prices reasonable for the quality and freshness of seafood.   Unfortunately, the service was a bit negligent. Our waitress rolled her eyes when no one at the table ordered alcohol. she questioned us when my partner had a a big in her water and we had to ask multiple times for a dessert menu then she left the dessert menu on our table and proceeded to talk to her coworker for so long no one had time to order anything more(more than 15 minutes). we had to get the bill from someone other than our waitress because she never revisited our table after.   to accompany a kitchen of that quality, I would suggest that they find a waitstaff that parallels it.

dnSokjW3PnITDy59nHmdLw.text: If charming people working at a restaurant matters then this has 5 stars.  It does so this has 5 stars.  The food is good, the fish is moist, fresh and not overlooked.  The scallops were good, but a bit too much garlic in the shells so I had to take them out of the shells.  The dessert was also great, the chocolate cake fresh and rich with perfect other ingredients to balance and make it interesting.  The creme brulee was almost an example in how to do them.  This place is the upper end of prices, but earns  it's prices properly.  The decor is smart, warm and the people there  are sophisticated.  For a while I did feel like one of the them and us elite, although of course that for me is not the point!  To go for good fresh food in a smart restaurant this is a good choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

VmgXyMBvHMlovU0_p6-FEQ.text: Excellent place, albeit a bit pricey. We had fish cakes and fish and chips plus lots of coffee.  Excellent service.

J8mvZuYu98Ha4STkYK-sCw.text: I went here based on the reviews and was really excited to try Scottish seafood since the produce is so wonderful.    Starting with the good - the service was really friendly and efficient. The waitress informed us beforehand of what was not available (was easter weekend) so understandably certain things were sold out. I hate it when I make my mind up about what I'm going to order to only be told that the item is not available.   We ordered the following: 6 oysters Pan fried scallops Posh fish and chips (cod and jumbo shrimp) 8 langoustines  Oysters. - very good and fresh.   Pan fried scallops - Good, but would have liked to have tried the hand dived ones which were sold out. Fish and chips - average, no much flavour in the batter Langoustines - a real let down. It seemed like they may have dig them out of the freezer from a couple of years back and cooked them up because they were dreadful.  Soft powdery flesh. I should have sent them back, but I was hoping I would get one decent langoustine having ordered 8 of them.   All in all, disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pan fried Scallops - decent
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Disappointing langoustines  Should have known by the dull orange colour.

xIDMUKUDJMm6gXU8-VWVng.text: Yikes.  From "the bartender is in a bad mood and says we  can't make that drink" when I ordered a Rob Roy (simple scotch whiskeys with sweet vermouth, not too complicated), to main entrees that literally were inedible, to service that was invisible, this is a "stay away" spot. Wife ordered a vodka gimlet, same response...."we can't make that here." Really need to not go here, you will thank me for this.

_NxKtOv5Nc2CqF7Do8oStQ.text: Menu is very interesting, with great selection. Sea food seems to be really fresh. Wait staff is very friendly. Service is excellent. The location is an  easy walk from old town I recommend this place

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

hcunHaY9chwlW7YeiNMAMg.text: Really excellent food with excellent service. The decor is modern, and the ambiance is quite romantic (read: a little dark for me). The food was quite outstanding, and everything was amazingly fresh and cooked to perfection. I was not that hungry, but that did not stop me from getting an appetizer with my meal. I got the quail egg salad, and the quail egg was delightfully soft in the middle. For the main meal, I got the fish of the day, which was a reasonably priced giant hunk of bass. I love when they leave the skin on -- to me it means they know what they are doing. Despite being super full, I shared an affogato with Husband, and it was a wonderful end to the meal.

6SU3-dectBfSaoX2PM2OTg.text: Great dining experience. The tables are a little cramped, but that is really just about the only negative thing about this place. It is also a little pricey. The service is excellent. The staff is attentive and not pushy. The food is great, but not outstanding. The drinks were great too. This is a good bet for a solid, nice meal. Parking is horrible, buts it's Edinburgh, so par for the course, and I wouldn't ding them for that.

ZAGt6_y1-pNw6eFWbet9eg.text: We came to this place on a recommendation for seafood and as I am a seafood person I was pretty excited to visit this place. We went in for an early dinner at around 6 pm and ordered drinks, the drinks were fantastic and they have an amazing range so you can order drinks starting from 4. I ordered a port as I love ports and found it on the menu ( which was super random  about me) and my partner went for a glass of whiskey.  We ordered Kashmiri curry with prawns and coley with steamed rice and went crazy. It was so yummy and my Indian spirits were totally uplifted. I would highly recommend this place if you are in the old town.  What's good - ambience, food, drinks, service  What impressed me - As I was happy and drunk, I left my cross-body in here () and our server came running after me to return it. Way to go!

5sQFT-SSnUG4k4iWMo49Dw.text: The food was ok. But service is horrible. The welcoming staff is as unwelcoming as possible. Half a dozen oysters came with only 5. The staff removed the plates and left juices on my pants. Don't recommend those who enjoy good service.   We won't come back.

rpfbbk513U7t4ttMwi7MzQ.text: Go for the seafood platter.  If you love perfectly cooked lobster, crab, langoustines, oysters, mussels and cockles swimming happily in garlicky. parsleyed butter, that is.  Yum.  We got the platter for two and could barely finish (two good appetites!).  It is all you need to order.  Plus maybe a beer or two.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Langoustine. Yum.
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Seafood platter for two. Amazingly good.

gPfL2qYe8-I5aLtYR9uiaA.text: Went for our first lunch in Edinburgh, and we enjoyed everything thoroughly.   I ordered the big portion of mussels in white wine broth and a glass of red wine. The food was delightful, and the mussels were very fresh. My friend ordered the lunch set menu, and she enjoyed everything too. She particularly liked the soup -- great for a chilly day in the city.   Service was good -- prompt and kind. Also appreciated the ambience -- it was sophisticated and yet down to earth.   If you're in the area, take a stroll down the alley and enjoy this lovely place!

nQFBy62IlMBRZZQKaGIneg.text: Finger bowls!! You get honest to goodness lemon rind in a tiny bowl of hot water so that you can keep your fingers clean as you disassemble your glorious tub of fresh delicious seafood. Scallops on the half shell, whole langoustines, split lobsters...all the greats were in play. Mussels in a garlic white wine sauce & uber fresh fish in an intimate dimly lit space. It was a tad warm for us (ah, August in the UK)... But we thoroughly enjoyed every minute.

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Seafood Platter for one--generous!
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussels
Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Smoked fish chowder

YaUsOOE8VyGpSmnSbNe-OQ.text: First class dining experience and reasonably priced.  Family group of 6 and everyone of us loved our meal.  Langoustines, scallops, turbot, salmon.  Fantastic reasonable wine list, great service.  We will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Fishers In The City - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3bbVTnjIbao3PLim_S6pdQ.text: Stopped by here on our last day in Edinburgh. Good fish and oysters. The veg soup was divine. super nice staff.

HlVIJosC06b_RMAA8FNF_Q.text: The manager here is great! Oysters were yum. I had the sole and my husband had the curry dish - both were really good. The sticky toffee pudding was amazing!
